page.title: 02HOUSING:B'HAM & MK WESTON
page.content: The population of Barningham has grown dramatically recently, with the addition of 2 private housing estates & the influx of personnel from nearby RAF Honington. There are Council houses, some of which are privately owned. It is a caring community with many volun- teers working for local charitable organisations. While some villages are dying Barningham is expanding but with a considerable migratory community. Market Weston is a smaller,quieter village, apart from the noise of RAF Tornado aircraft overhead.The County structure plan allows little new development but several old cottages have been renovated with grant aid. There are some Council owned houses & 2 old peoples bungalows.Both villages have main drainage (due to their loca- tion some proterties use septic tanks), water,electricity & GPO services.
